newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian share trade down, Hansa, Hoiu active.
newsitem.headline: Estonian share trade down, Hansa, Hoiu active.

text.p: Volumes fell away on Tuesday on the Estonian bourse, with interest in Hansapank and Hoiupank sustaining the market.
But dealers said the low liquidity was exaggerating price movements. Total trade on the main list was 26.2 million kroons with the Talse 0.78 percent higher at 253.36.
"Some of the price changes we saw today were too great for the volume," one trader said.
"Low liquidity on the bourse is affecting the prices more than news," he added.
Hoiupank was most traded with 8.1 million kroons moved for a small price gain of 0.42 kroons to reach 132.27 kroons.
"Its price is traded on a bit of a premium compared to the rest of the market, but its results are solid and its earnings are getting better," one dealer said.
Hansapank rose 2.05 kroons to 132.90 kroons on trade worth 6.3 million kroons.
Its shares have also been boosted slightly by news that it would consider offers from foreign banks for a partnership although it was not actively seeking an investor.
The free market turned over 2.5 million kroons with Tallinna Kaubamaja the most active stock with a trade of 0.8 million kroons. Kaubamaja picked up 0.40 kroons to close on 41.90 kroons.
